Research Statement

14 Nov 2015 . about-me . Comments #about me #research

Iâ€™m an scientist studying oceanography at Scripps Institution of Oceanography, UC San Diego. As a physical oceanography, I strive to understand how the ocean works, and its relation to the climate system. In particular, I seek to understand the dynamics of turbulent flows in the upper ocean.

In my research, I tend to focus on problem, not methods. In particular, I try to break artificial barriers that separate theory, high-performance computing, and analysis of observations in oceanography. It is time to move past silly statements like I do not believe in models. The solution to the great scientific problems of the 21st century will require a judicious combination theory, computational modeling, and observations. 

I'm also interested in applied mathematics, data science, fluid mechanics, environmental and geophysical fluid dynamics, high-performance computing, and big data. I do not see these topics as separate fields. Instead, I actively
incorporate their practices and method into my research in oceanography.
